availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, farmer. Shelby County native. Son of John Crawford and Cassandra Thomas Crawford. Married Phebe Guthrie Crawford on December 14, 1848. Father of James Crawford, Louella Crawford, John C. Crawford, Edwin T. Crawford, and Robert F. Crawford. Merchant in Chestnut Grove, Kentucky, from 1859 to 1860. Farmer in Shelby County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved people in Shelby County in 1860.

bibl.p: W. H. Perrin, J. H. Battle, and G. C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State, 6th ed. (Louisville and Chicago: F. A. Battey and Company, 1888), 779-80; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District No. 1, p. 50; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District No. 1, p. 21; Find A Grave, "James W Crawford (1821 - 1899)," Memorial #28936753, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=28936753 (accessed September 28, 2017).
